abstract: Indian Prime Min Narendra Modi's announcement of Digitial India campaign underscores fact that country has lagged behind rest of world in digital infrastructure, particularly in lack of progress in expanding fiber optic network; campaign aims to cut imports of electronics significantly and to provide all citizens with access to number of services digitally, although it is more statement of intent than set of policy proposals.
lead_paragraph: With the country lagging behind much of the world in digital infrastructure, Prime Minister Narendra Modi is pushing for greater Internet connectivity and services as well as electronics manufacturing.

headline.main: India’s Leader Maps Out a More Robust Digital Future
headline.print_headline: India’s Leader Maps Out a More Robust Digital Future

snippet: With the country lagging behind much of the world in digital infrastructure, Prime Minister Narendra Modi is pushing for greater Internet connectivity and services as well as electronics manufacturing.
